title: Measurement of CD74 N-terminal Fragment Accumulation in Cells Treated with SPPL2a Inhibitor
procedures: Chemical inhibition of SPPL2a in PBMCs and EBV-B cellsPlate 106 EBV-B cells or PBMCs (both grown in suspension) in triplicate, in culture medium, at a density of 106 cells/ml in a 24-well plate.Immediately after plating, treat one well with 1 μM of DMSO, a second well with 10 μM DAPT (generic gamma secretase inhibitor used as a negative control because it does not inhibit SPPL2a; on delivery, it should be dissolved in DMSO to yield a 100 mM solution, which is then stored at -20 °C, protected against freeze-thaw cycles cycles) and a third one should be treated with a 1 μM solution of the gamma secretase/SPPL inhibitor L-685,458 (stock solution at 1 mM, storage at -20 °C, protected against freeze-thaw cycles).Incubate the cells at 37 °C, under an atmosphere containing 5% CO2, in a tissue culture incubator for 24 h, without shaking.Western-blot analysis of CD74-NTF accumulation in EBV-B cells After treatment, transfer the EBV-B cells into a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube and centrifuge them for 5 min at 300 x g at room temperature.Remove the supernatant. Resuspend the EBV-B cells in 2 ml of PBS and centrifuge them again for 5 min at 300 x g at room temperature.Remove the supernatant.Resuspend the EBV-B cells in 30 μl of ice-cold RIPA buffer.Vortex for 30 s. Incubate on ice for 20 min.Centrifuge at 18,000 x g for 20 min at 4 °C.Collect the supernatant containing the protein.Assess protein concentration with the BioRad protein assay according to the kit manufacturer’s instructions (BioRad protein assay[href=http://www.bio-rad.com/webroot/web/pdf/lsr/literature/LIT33.pdf]).Mix 50 μg of protein with a 1/5 volume of 5x Laemmli loading buffer.Incubate for 5 min at 55 °C.

Perform electrophoresis in a precast 4-12% acrylamide SDS-PAGE gel in MES buffer, with 5 μl of Full-Range Rainbow Molecular Weight Marker as the size standard, according to the manufacturer’s instructions (A Guide to Polyacrylamide Gel Electrophoresis and Detection[href=http://www.bio-rad.com/webroot/web/pdf/lsr/literature/Bulletin_6040.pdf]).Transfer proteins to a PVDF membrane according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Immobilon-P-PVDF membrane[href=http://www.emdmillipore.com/US/en/product/Immobilon-P-PVDF-Membrane,MM_NF-IPVH00010]).Block the membrane by incubating for 1 h at room temperature in blocking buffer.Remove the blocking buffer and wash the membrane with TBS-T.Incubate the membrane overnight, with shaking, with an anti-CD74 antibody specifically recognizing the NTF of CD74 (cleaved or uncleaved) diluted 1:1,000 in 1% BSA in TBS-T at 4 °C.The following day, wash the membrane four times by incubation with TBS-T, for 5 min per wash, on an orbital shaker, at room temperature.Add anti-rabbit HRP-conjugated secondary antibody to the membrane at a dilution of 1:5,000 in 1% BSA in TBS-T and incubate for 30 min on an orbital shaker at room temperature.Wash the membrane five times, as described above (point 18), at room temperature.Develop the membrane with ECL substrate according to the manufacturer’s instructions (PierceTM ECL Western Blotting Substrate[href=https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/32106]). The signal should become visible after exposure for five minutes.Strip the membrane with WB stripping buffer at room temperature.Block the membrane by incubation for 1 h in blocking buffer at room temperature.Remove the blocking buffer and wash the membrane with TBS-T at room temperature.Incubate the membrane for 1 h, with shaking, with HRP-conjugated anti-GAPDH antibody diluted 1:5,000 in 1% BSA in TBS-T at room temperature.Wash the membrane five times by incubating with TBS-T, for five minutes per wash, on an orbital shaker at room temperature.Develop the membrane with ECL substrate according to the manufacturer’s instructions  (PierceTM ECL Western Blotting Substrate[href=https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/32106]). The signal should become visible after 2 min of exposure.

FACS analysis of CD74-NTF accumulation in different PBMC populations Centrifuge PBMCs at 300 x g for 5 min.Remove supernatant and resuspend PBMCs in FACS buffer and centrifuge again at 300 x g for 5 min.Isolate CD14+ cells by MACS (CD14 microbeads) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (CD14 MicroBeads, human[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/US-en/products/macs-cell-separation/cell-separation-reagents/microbeads-and-isolation-kits/monocytes-and-macrophages/cd14-microbeads-human.html#130-050-201]).Isolate CD3+ cells from the flow through (CD14-), by MACS (CD3 microbeads) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (CD3 microbeads, human[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/US-en/products/macs-cell-separation/cell-separation-reagents/microbeads-and-isolation-kits/t-cells/cd3-microbeads-human.html#130-050-101]).Isolate CD19+ and CD56+ cells from the flow through (CD14-, CD3-) by MACS (CD19 and CD56 microbeads) according to the manufacturer’s instructions (CD19 Microbeads, human[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/US-en/products/macs-cell-separation/cell-separation-reagents/microbeads-and-isolation-kits/b-cells/cd19-microbeads-human.html#130-050-301] and CD56 microbeads, human[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/US-en/products/macs-cell-separation/cell-separation-reagents/microbeads-and-isolation-kits/nk-cells/cd56-microbeads-human.html#130-050-401]).Wash these four fractions–CD14+, CD3+, CD19+CD56+ cells and the flow through (CD14-, CD3-, CD19-, CD56-)–twice by resuspension in 2 ml of FACS buffer and centrifugation at 300 x g for 5 min, removing the supernatant.Stain the cells in a 96-well plate with V-bottomed wells. Re-suspend fractions 1 and 2 (CD14+ and CD3+) in 50 μl of FACS buffer with Live/Dead Fixable Aqua 1:1,000. Re-suspend fractions 3 (CD19+CD56+) in 50 μl of FACS buffer with Live/Dead Fixable Aqua 1:1,000, anti-CD20-PE and anti CD56-Alexa700 antibodies. Re-suspend fractions 4 (CD14-, CD3-, CD19-, CD56-) in 50 μl of FACS buffer with Live/Dead Fixable Aqua 1:1,000, anti-CD11c-PerCP-Cy5.5, anti-HLA-DR-V450, anti-CD123-PE-Cy7, anti-CD1c-APC-Cy7 and anti-CD141-PE antibodies (Table 1). Use all antibodies at a dilution of 1:50, and incubate the cells with the corresponding mixture for 30 min on ice. Table 1. Staining panelsimgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/20190530/20190530183935_0243.jpgWash cells twice by adding 100 μl of FACS buffer and centrifuging the plate at 350 x g for 3 min.Fix and permeabilize the cells with 100 μl of BD Cytofix/Cytoperm according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Fixation and Permeabilization Solution[href=http://www.bdbiosciences.com/us/applications/research/t-cell-immunology/th-1-cells/intracellular-markers/cytokines-and-chemokines/buffers/fixation-and-permeabilization-solution/p/554722]).Perform intracellular staining by incubation with 50 μl of anti-CD74 antibody diluted 1:500 in intracellular staining buffer for 45 min at 4 °C.

Wash cells twice each with 100 μl of intracellular staining buffer.For the final staining step, resuspend cells in 50 μl of intracellular staining buffer with anti-mouse-Alexa 488 secondary antibody diluted 1:1,000.Finally, wash the cells twice with FACS buffer and resuspend them in 100 μl of FACS buffer.Collect data in an LSR-II at a rate of 1000 events per second with FACS diva software, after appropriate compensation.
